channel.title: World news
channel.description: Get the latest World news and international news from the Telegraph. Your source for US, Europe, China and African news.
channel.copyright: ℗ & © 2015 of Telegraph Media Group Limited. Please refer to the Terms and Conditions of Use at http://www.telegraph.co.uk/rss

item.title: Why does the British Royal Family visit Saudi Arabia but not Israel?
item.description: Members of the Royal family regularly visit authoritarian Arab states, but they have not made an official trip to Israel since the country was founded
item.author: Raf Sanchez

item.title: Donald Trump revels in his 'yuge' lead over Republican rivals
item.description: The maverick billionaire is on a roll less than 60 days before the Iowa caucus
item.author: Nick Allen

item.title: San Bernardino shooting: Isil claims followers carried out attack - live
item.description: FBI now consider attack by Syed Farook and Tashfeen Malik "act of terrorism"- latest updates
item.author: Jessica Winch

item.title: Plane passenger captures first Momotombo volcano eruption in 110 years
item.description: First eruption of Nicaragua's Momotombo volcano in 110 years is caught on camera by a plane passenger flying near to it
item.author: Charlotte Krol

item.title: Latest pictures show Isil training camp in Afghanistan
item.description: The images show masked terrorists training near Afghanistan's mountainous border with Pakistan
item.author: Foreign Staff

item.title: Aftermath of alleged Russian airstrikes on Syria oil trucks shows vehicles engulfed by huge flames
item.description: Shocking footage shows firefighters attempting to tackle three blazing oil trucks in Syria that were allegedly targeted during Russian airstrikes
item.author: Charlotte Krol

item.title: Col John Blashford-Snell: the last of the great explorers
item.description: Navigating deadly African rivers and transporting a piano to an Amazon jungle chief, explorerer Col John Blashford-Snell's life has been the stuff of Boy's Own adventures
item.author: Jessamy Calkin

item.title: San Bernardino shooting: Suspects' family 'in complete shock'
item.description: Lawyers of the family of San Bernardino shooting suspects say the family is in "shock", and the attorneys urge the public to not jump to conclusions about the alleged killers' motives
item.author: Charlotte Krol

item.title: Syed Farook and Tashfeen Malik: What we know about the San Bernardino shooters
item.description: Gunman worked for the county public health department and opened fire on colleagues at Christmas party with Tashfeen Malik
item.author: Rob Crilly

item.title: Inside San Bernardino suspect's home
item.description: Journalists have reported from inside the home of Syed Farook and Tashfeen Malik in San Bernardino, California
item.author: Telegraph Staff

item.title: Low turnout in Egypt parliament poll dominated by pro-government candidates
item.description: About 28 per cent of Egyptian voters cast ballots in a staggered parliamentary election dominated by pro-government candidates
item.author: Telegraph Staff

item.title: San Bernardino shooting: Inside the home of the suspects
item.description: The landlord of one of the suspect's flat is opened to the media near San Bernardino, US
item.author: Telegraph Video

item.title: The Bermuda Triangle: Whatever became of the myth
item.description: Seventy years after the disappearance of five planes in the Atlantic, Giles Milton investigates one of the world's most enduring aviation mysteries
item.author: Giles Milton

item.title: Pakistan petition demands return of Kohinoor diamond from Britain
item.description: Barrister says the Queen must hand back famed diamond that was 'forcibly and under duress' taken from what is now Pakistan
item.author: Barney Henderson

item.title: Isil antiques 'sold to western collectors' warns French finance minister
item.description: French finance minister calls for stricter controls to prevent Isil profiting from illicit trade in antiquities plundered from sites such as Palmyra in Syria
item.author: Telegraph Staff

item.title: Paris cafe La Bonne Biere reopens after terror attacks
item.description: La Bonne Biere, a Paris cafe targeted by gunmen in the November terror attacks, has reopened for business
item.author: David Chazan

item.title: Ukrainian oligarchs clash in court over $2bn business deal amid claims of murder and bribery
item.description: A businessman is bringing a $2 billion dispute against two other oligarchs over the 2004 purchase of a mining company in the Ukraine.
item.author: David Barrett

item.title: Danish PM backs David Cameron's plan for 'slimmer' EU after referendum defeat
item.description: Lars Loekke Rasmussen says resounding No vote in Danish referendum shows there is 'considerable scepticism about the European project'
item.author: Matthew Holehouse

item.title: Hanukkah 2015: What is the Jewish Festival of Lights and when does it begin?
item.description: Doughnuts, dreidels and a nine-branched candle holder. Here's all you need to know about Hanukkah, the Jewish Festival of Lights
item.author: Cameron Macphail

item.title: Russia sends its most advanced tanks to Syria frontline
item.description: Deployment of T-90 tanks is latest sign that Kremlin is being forced to escalate its intervention from an air to a ground war
item.author: Telegraph Staff
